title: Introduction to NoSQL
subject: MongoDB
theory: NoSQL (Not Only SQL) databases are non-tabular databases and store data differently than relational tables. They come in a variety of types based on their data model: Document, Key-value, Wide-column, and Graph. NoSQL provides a mechanism for storage and retrieval of data modeled in means other than typical tabular relations.

examples.explanation: Unlike a table row, a NoSQL document can have nested structures and arrays.

common_mistakes.correction: NoSQL is schema-flexible, not schema-less. You still need to design how data is stored.
common_mistakes.example: Putting random fields in every document makes querying impossible.

interview_questions.question: Name four types of NoSQL databases.

real_world_use_cases.description: Handling massive volumes of unstructured data (posts, comments, likes) with high velocity.

summary: NoSQL offers flexibility and scalability for modern applications dealing with large volumes of unstructured data.
